entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow with periods of blizzard conditions and freezing rain. entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued January 13 at 6:30AM AKST until January 14 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...LONG DURATION SNOW EVENT FOR THIS WEEKEND... .Light snow has begun and will continue into the weekend across the northern panhandle. 4 to 6 inches of snow has fallen from Gustavus to Juneau by 6 am. Snowfall rates will gradually increase in intensity through the weekend as well. Snow has started dry and fluffy but may become wetter and heavier as temperatures warm

entry.summary: ...Burst of snow and blowing snow moving through... A band of snow and blowing snow will move through late this afternoon. entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. entry.title: Avalanche Warning issued January 12 at 12:09PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Bridger-Teton Avalanche Center in Jackson has issued a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING which is in effect until 10 PM MST Saturday... * WHAT...The combination of strong winds and new snow falling on a weak snowpack will create widespread areas of unstable snow. Avalanche danger is High with very dangerous avalanche
entry.cap:areaDesc: Jackson Hole; Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Star Valley; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains

entry.title: Avalanche Watch issued January 11 at 8:51PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Bridger-Teton Avalanche Center in Jackson has issued a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WATCH which is in effect until 5 AM MST Friday... * WHAT...The combination of strong winds and new snow falling on a weak snowpack will create widespread areas of unstable snow. Avalanche danger is expected to rise to High tomorrow with very dangerous avalanche
entry.cap:areaDesc: Jackson Hole; Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Star Valley; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains
